Description: Portrait of a bearded man in tempera on limewood with added gold leaf.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Kom el-Kharaba el-Kebir (Previously recorded as Rubaiyat)
Curator's comments: Published: S Walker and M Bierbrier, Ancient Faces (London, 1997), 94, 95 (no. 85).
Bibliographic references: Newman et al 2013 / The study and conservation of four ancient Egyptian funerary portraits: provenance, conservation history and structural treatment (p.1-13, p.2, fig.1, p.4, table.1, p.6, fig.4, p.10, fig.9, p.11, fig.10) (Portrait D)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001 13 Mar-24 Jun, Australia, Canberra, National Museum of Australia, Gold and Civilisation 2001 19 Jul-21 Oct, Australia, Melbourne, Museum Victoria, Gold and Civilisation
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: National Gallery 3932 (Long Term Loan)
